results.brief_description: Demonstrates how an electric charge is detected and how the positive and negative quality of the charge is determined.

results.title: The Electronic telephone
results.brief_description: This short film is about telecommunications, silicon technology, and the E-phone and Bell’s role in its development. The E-phone is the world’s first fully electronic telephone. Chips utilized in it were designed by Bell Northern Research in Ottawa. Northern Telecom makes 256 phones an hour, on one production line alone. As Canada changes, the telephone changes with it and this film includes historical glimpses with a montage of shots from a telephone museum.

results.title: The Electronic Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Electronic Office”.
A computer education program that consists of six parts, each 25 minutes long. The parts are: 1.”Office on the move”, 2.”The stand-alone micro”, 3. “Wiring up the organisation”, 4. “Changing with the times”, 5. “Wiring up the world”, 6.”Easy to use”.

results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Division of Visual Aids, US Office of Education
results.brief_description: Explains the nature of electrons, electron flow in solid conductors, electromotive force, control of electron flow, electron flow and magnetic fields, and induced electron flow.

results.title: The Electron's tale
results.creator_credit: Bob Godfrey, Peter Green, Beryl Stevens, Film Producers Guild and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: Made to mark Mullard’s 50th anniversary. In a light-hearted vein, this film describes the development of electronics from the electron’s point of view. Live action scenes supplement the cartoon sequences unobtrusively to bring home the importance of the role played by electrons in our lives.

results.title: The Electromagnetic spectrum
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Provides demonstrations of ultra-violet and infra-red radiation, radio waves and microwaves and shows the application of reflection of light in medical technology particularly X-ray machines, broadcasting and microwave ovens. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Electro-magnet
results.creator_credit: Harry Dance, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: The principles and application of the electro-magnet, production of magnetic fields by simple experiments; effect of introducing iron cores; retention of magnetism by a steel core; use of electro-magnets in telephone receivers and telephone exchanges; a “self-starter” of a motor vehicle leads on to consideration of AC and DC motors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Dance, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: The Electric horseman
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Wildwood Enterprises, Universal Pictures and Columbia Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: When a has-been, drunken rodeo star reduced to starring in breakfast cereal advertisments finds out the multi-million dollar racehorse he is expected to ride for a publicity stunt has been drugged, he steals it, riding it out into the Nevada desert where it can recuperate. Seeing a good story, a newswoman (Jane Fonda) follows him, staying one step ahead of a posse of pursuing police. By the time they reach a remote rendezvous high in the Utah mountains, she is in love with both the cowboy and his convictions.

results.title: The Electric grandmother
results.creator_credit: Noel Black, Doro Bachrach and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Ray Bradbury story “I Sing the Body Electric”. A young family who lose their mother through death are subsequently delivered an electric ‘grandmother’ who seeks to provide for all their needs, both emotional and physical. This film provides an insight inside into child versus adult perceptions of growth, ageing, human relationships and man’s motivation for creating machines
